question_details.title: Will the US Mint list the amount of present gold holdings of Fort Knox as 147.3 million ounces on April 1, 2025?
question_details.description: [Musk signals DOGE could look into gold at Fort Knox](https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/5149699-elon-musk-doge-fort-knox-gold/)
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the amount of present gold holdings of Fort Knox is listed as 147.3 million ounces at [this link](https://www.usmint.gov/learn/tours-and-locations/fort-knox) when checked by Metaculus on or after April 1, 2025.
question_details.fine_print: No other resolution source will be considered. Question resolves based on the value shown at the specific webpage listed. Should the webpage be offline on April 1, 2025, resolution will wait until the end of this tournament's resolutions, at which time if the page is still down the question will be **annulled**.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Polyus Increases Gold Production by 7% to 3 Million Ounces in 2024**
Polyus increased its gold production by 7% to a record 3 million ounces in 2024, according to the company. The second half of the year saw a 12% increase compared to the same period in 2023, reaching 1.5 million ounces. Polyus estimates that gold production in 2025 will be in the range of 2.5-2.6 million ounces, citing a possible decline due to the decrease in processing content at the Olympiad site, as the Eastern pit's fourth stage has been completed and the company is increasing the volume of stripping work on the fifth stage. Production is expected to remain at 2.5-2.6 million ounces until 2027, after which the gold content in the ore at the Eastern pit is expected to increase again. 'Polyus' CEO said, 'We are pleased with the results of 2024 and are confident in our ability to maintain production levels in the coming years.' 
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 05, 2025 06:37 AM
Source:[Interfax.ru](https://www.interfax.ru/business/1012027)

**Russia's Polyus says 2024 EBITDA at record $5.7 billion**
Russian gold producer Polyus reported a 49% increase in its 2024 EBITDA, reaching a record $5.7 billion, driven by rising gold prices and production, which reached 3 million ounces of gold in 2024, a 7% increase from the previous year. The company stated that total Q4 dividends could be at least 30% of the company's Q4 2024 EBITDA.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 06:37 AM
Source:[Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/markets/commodities/russias-polyus-says-2024-ebitda-record-57-billion-2025-03-05/)

**Elon Musk Raises Questions About Fort Knox Gold Reserves**
Elon Musk has expressed doubts about the amount of gold stored at Fort Knox, stating, 'Who is confirming that gold wasn’t stolen from Fort Knox? Maybe it’s there, maybe it’s not. We want to know if it’s still there!' He emphasized that the gold belongs to the American public and that transparency is crucial in verifying the reserves. Musk's comments have sparked questions about the importance of transparency in gold reserves and the implications for investors.
Original language: fr
Publish date: March 04, 2025 05:57 PM
Source:[businessbourse.com](https://www.businessbourse.com/2025/03/04/elon-musk-doute-sur-la-quantite-dor-detenue-a-fort-knox-qui-confirme-que-lor-na-pas-ete-vole-a-fort-knox-il-y-est-peut-etre-il-ny-est-peut-etre-pas-nous-voulons-savoir-sil-est-toujo/)

**Fort Knox Gold Conspiracy Theories Sparked by Elon Musk and Donald Trump**
The recent surge in gold prices has put the focus on the United States' gold reserves, particularly those stored at Fort Knox in Kentucky. According to the US Mint, Fort Knox holds over half of the US Treasury's gold, approximately 4,852 tons (or 147,300,000 troy ounces), valued at around 62 trillion KRW (approximately 620 trillion KRW) at current prices. Due to security concerns, Fort Knox is closed to outsiders, and the last time it was opened to the press was in 1974. This has led to ongoing conspiracy theories about the existence of gold at Fort Knox. Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, recently hinted at investigating the matter on social media, saying 'Fort Knox may or may not have gold.' Donald Trump also announced that he would visit Fort Knox with Musk, sparking speculation about a possible audit. In contrast, the South Korean government does not store gold domestically. The Bank of Korea's 104.4 tons (or 8,380 gold bars) of gold are stored at the Bank of England. The Bank of Korea has stored gold abroad due to transportation costs and transaction convenience, but with the recent increase in global gold demand, there is a possibility that the Bank of England's gold liquidity may become a problem, raising questions about whether it is still acceptable to store gold abroad.
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 04, 2025 07:25 AM
Source:[YTN](https://www.ytn.co.kr/_ln/0134_202503041554323475)

**Countries with the Largest Gold Reserves**
The World Gold Council (WGC) has updated its ranking of countries by gold reserves. The United States remains the global leader in gold reserves, with approximately 8,130 tons. More than half of the US gold reserve is stored at the Fort Knox facility in Kentucky. Germany has the largest gold reserves in Europe, with around 3,350 tons. Belarus has a significant gold reserve of nearly 54 tons, surpassing those of countries like the Czech Republic, Kyrgyzstan, and Lithuania. The top 5 countries by gold reserves are: 1. USA - 8,130 tons 2. Germany - 3,350 tons 3. Italy - 2,450 tons 4. France - 2,440 tons 5. Russia - 2,335 tons.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 04, 2025 06:37 AM
Source:[Пресс-центр "АиФ"](https://aif.by/economic-news/u_kakih_stran_naibolshiy_obem_zolotyh_rezervov)

**The 600-ton Gold Rush: A Sign of Global Economic Turmoil**
A 'gold rush' has swept the global financial market, with over 600 tons of gold being transported from London, Switzerland, and Singapore to the US Federal Reserve's vault in New York since December last year, equivalent to 15% of the world's annual gold production. This has led to a surge in global central banks' demand for gold, with the World Gold Council reporting that the total demand for physical gold in 2024 reached 4974 tons, a new record high. The US Federal Reserve has continued to dominate the gold market, purchasing over 1000 tons of gold in 2024, accounting for 20% of the total demand last year. The market is speculating about the implications of this gold rush, including the potential for a shift in the global economic landscape. The three main drivers of this phenomenon are tariffs, arbitrage opportunities, and risk aversion. The US government's trade policy uncertainty under President Trump has triggered a 'pre-emptive hoarding' of gold, with traders seeking to avoid potential tariffs by moving gold to the US before the policy takes effect. The Swiss customs data shows that the export of gold to the US in January 2025 reached a 13-year high, while Singapore and the UK also saw significant increases in gold exports. The price difference between futures and spot gold has widened to a record high of $35 per ounce, creating an arbitrage opportunity for traders to buy gold in London and resell it in the US. The main driver of this phenomenon, however, is the risk aversion driven by the geopolitical tensions and the US dollar's credit crisis. The US Federal Reserve's decision to audit the gold reserves at Fort Knox has sparked concerns about the transparency of the US gold management, with some speculating that the audit may reveal discrepancies in the gold reserves. If the audit confirms the suspicions, it could lead to a devastating blow to the US dollar's creditworthiness and a surge in gold prices. The future of gold prices is uncertain, but some analysts predict that it may follow a 'short-term surge, mid-term volatility, and long-term differentiation' pattern. The US government's potential imposition of tariffs on gold imports could push gold prices above $3000 per ounce in the second quarter of 2025. The US Federal Reserve's expected rate cut could also reduce the opportunity cost of holding gold, attracting more institutional investors to the market. However, the market may experience a short-term correction if the US inflation data exceeds expectations, forcing the Federal Reserve to delay the rate cut. The long-term trend of gold prices will depend on the shift towards a multi-polar pricing system, with emerging markets seeking to establish a gold-backed trade settlement system to challenge the US dollar's dominance. The potential for a 'dual-track' gold market, with Western markets dominated by futures and Eastern markets driven by physical demand, could lead to a significant increase in gold prices in the long term.

Publish date: March 04, 2025 01:17 AM

**Tunkillia JORC Resources Grow to 1.6Moz gold, 3.1Moz silver**
Barton Gold Holdings Limited has announced a Mineral Resources update for its South Australian Tunkillia Gold Project. The update shows that the project's gold resources have grown to 1.6 million ounces, while silver resources have increased to 3.1 million ounces. The company has added approximately 120,000 ounces of gold to the project's resources. The update is a significant step forward for the project, which is expected to contribute to the company's future growth and success.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 03, 2025 11:51 PM
Source:[Joplin Globe](https://www.joplinglobe.com/region/tunkillia-jorc-resources-grow-to-1-6moz-gold-3-1moz-silver/article_0780ef84-b6d7-558f-b2f2-206507906106.html)

**The 12 Remaining Sacagawea Coins: A Piece of Living History**
There are only 12 remaining Sacagawea coins, a series of gold coins minted in 1999 by the United States Mint, which were later sent to space on the Columbia space shuttle as a tribute to Eileen Collins, the first American woman to command a space shuttle mission. The coins were then stored in Fort Knox, Kentucky, where they remain to this day. The coins are extremely rare and valuable, with their space travel and connection to a historic figure making them even more unique. The designer of the coin, Thomas D. Rogers Sr., has spoken about the controversy surrounding the number of feathers on the coin's design, which has sparked debate among collectors. The coins are now considered priceless and are unlikely to be sold, making them a piece of living history that symbolizes exploration, remembrance, and the value of small things that can have a significant impact.
Original language: es
Publish date: March 03, 2025 08:16 PM
Source:[El Comercio Perú](https://elcomercio.pe/mag/respuestas/us/solo-quedan-12-monedas-de-este-tipo-son-tan-raras-que-ni-siquiera-estan-a-la-venta-estados-unidos-nnda-nnlt-noticia/)

**Gold & Silver Are Flooding Into US Warehouses**
Gold and silver are pouring into US warehouses at a rate not seen since the pandemic, sparking speculation that the US may be preparing to revalue its gold reserves. The current market price of gold is around $3,000, while the US's gold reserves are valued at $42 an ounce. Bloomberg macro strategist Simon White notes that 'You're never far away from conspiracy in the gold market,' but suggests that one should keep an open mind to stay solvent. With Donald Trump in charge, the theory that the US may be revaluing its gold reserves cannot be completely discounted.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 03, 2025 05:37 PM
Source:[Zero Hedge](https://www.zerohedge.com/precious-metals/gold-silver-are-flooding-us-warehouses)

**Arthur Hayes Calls Trump's Cryptocurrency Reserve Fund Plan 'Empty Words'**
Arthur Hayes, co-founder of BitMEX, called Donald Trump's statement about creating a cryptocurrency reserve fund 'empty words'. Trump announced on March 2 that he instructed his team to 'move forward' with establishing a state fund for digital assets, which would include the following cryptocurrencies: 'Nothing new. Empty words. Let me know when Congress approves a loan or revalues the gold stored at Fort Knox to a higher value. Without that, they won't have the money to buy bitcoins and shibcoins,' Hayes wrote. According to the US Treasury, the federal budget deficit in the 2024 fiscal year, which ended on September 30, 2024, was $1.83 trillion, $138 billion more than in the previous reporting period. Hayes is not exaggerating when he says that the US government lacks funds to buy cryptocurrencies. However, one commentator suggested that the fund for digital assets could be created without Congressional approval, and initially, it would be funded with seized cryptocurrencies. Currently, the government holds $18.4 billion in bitcoins and $136.9 million in ethers, which could serve as the foundation for the reserve fund that Trump is advocating for.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 03, 2025 08:05 AM
Source:[Investing.com Россия](https://ru.investing.com/news/cryptocurrency-news/article-2675840)

**Elon Musk and Donald Trump to Visit Fort Knox to Verify Gold Reserves**
Fort Knox, a US military base in Kentucky, has been the subject of interest for Elon Musk and Donald Trump, who plan to visit the site with a camera to verify the presence of the 147 million ounces of gold stored there. The gold reserves, which have been stored at Fort Knox since 1937, are audited annually by the US Treasury, and the Mint of the United States has confirmed that the gold is present and accounted for. However, some have questioned the accuracy of the audits, leading to a legend that the gold has been stolen or spent. The visit by Musk and Trump is expected to provide clarity on the matter, as they will be live-streaming their entry into the base with a camera. According to the US Mint, the current gold reserves at Fort Knox amount to 147.3 million ounces, which is a significant decrease from the 649.6 million ounces stored in 1941.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 25, 2025 05:24 PM
Source:[COPE | Noticias y radio online](https://www.cope.es/programas/la-linterna/audios/paso-fort-knox-147-millones-onzas-oro-estados-unidos-hay-teoria-elon-musk-ira-comprobarlo-20250225_3102593.html)

**Donald Trump and Elon Musk to Inspect Fort Knox Gold Reserves**
Donald Trump and Elon Musk have expressed their desire to verify the integrity of the US gold reserves, including those stored at the highly secure Fort Knox site. They have rekindled an old conspiracy theory. According to CBS News, Elon Musk will soon visit Fort Knox to ensure that the gold is still present, as announced by Donald Trump. 'We will open the doors. We will inspect Fort Knox,' Trump said on February 20. 'I don't want to open it and find out the shelves are empty,' he added. The US Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, has assured that the gold reserves are intact, stating that an annual audit is conducted and all the gold is present and accounted for. The US Mint reports that the gold reserves currently stored at Fort Knox amount to 147.3 million ounces, worth over $400 billion at current prices. This represents approximately half of the US gold reserves. Only small quantities have been removed for testing the gold's purity during regular audits. No gold has been transferred in or out of the vault for many years, according to the institution. The last visit to the Kentucky site for non-authorized individuals was in 2017, when the Treasury Secretary, Steve Mnuchin, the Governor of Kentucky, Matt Bevin, and Congressional representatives visited the vaults. They were opened for the first time to civilians in 1974 to silence rumors that the gold had been removed from the vaults.
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 25, 2025 12:14 PM
Source:[BFMTV](https://www.bfmtv.com/economie/international/fort-knox-quelle-est-cette-reserve-d-or-que-donald-trump-veut-faire-verifier_AN-202502250439.html)

**Trump Says He's Going With Musk to Check If There Is Gold in Fort Knox**
President Donald Trump announced that he and Elon Musk will visit Fort Knox to verify the presence of gold reserves. Trump said, 'Would anybody like to join us? Because we want to see if the gold is still there.' The president also stated that they will 'open those doors' and 'take a look' at the gold reserves, which are valued at $42.22 per ounce. Trump expressed his desire to see 'lots of nice, beautiful, shiny gold' in Fort Knox, and joked that they might find 'nothing here, they stole this too!' The U.S. Mint reports that the current gold holdings at Fort Knox are 147.3 million ounces, and that only small quantities have been removed for testing during regular audits.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 09:03 PM
Source:[www.theepochtimes.com](https://www.theepochtimes.com/us/trump-says-hes-going-with-musk-to-check-if-there-is-gold-in-fort-knox-5814984)

**All about the Fort Knox gold depository that Elon Musk is now in-charge of**
President Donald Trump has announced that Elon Musk will be inspecting the United States Bullion Depository at Fort Knox, a legendary depository in Kentucky that stores American gold reserves. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has stated that there is an annual audit and that 'all the gold is present and accounted for.' The depository has been a secure and well-protected facility since 1937, storing precious metal bullion reserves for the United States. It is currently also used as the Army's human resources command center and hosts the Army's largest annual training event each summer. The gold holdings at Fort Knox are currently 147.3 million ounces, with about half of the Treasury's stored gold kept at the facility. According to the U.S. Mint, only small quantities of gold have been removed for testing during regular audits, and no gold has been transferred to or from the depository for many years.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 04:49 AM
Source:[Hindustan Times](https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/all-about-the-fort-knox-gold-depository-that-elon-musk-is-now-in-charge-of-101740282165287.html)

**🎥Trump: We're going to check the Fort Knox gold depository**
President Donald Trump has announced that Elon Musk will be inspecting the Fort Knox gold depository to verify the presence of the gold reserves. However, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has stated that there is an annual audit and 'all the gold is present and accounted for.' The US Bullion Depository at Fort Knox has stored American gold reserves since 1937 and is considered a secure facility. According to the U.S. Mint, the current gold holdings at Fort Knox are 147.3 million ounces, with about half of the Treasury's stored gold kept at the depository. The facility is heavily guarded and has only been opened to a select few, including a group of journalists and a congressional delegation in 1974, and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin in 2017.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 22, 2025 07:00 PM
Source:[littleapplepost.com](https://littleapplepost.com/posts/449caa78-a8ae-4a02-8daa-100f44d2139a)

**World News | Trump Gives Call for Inspecting America's 400 Tonnes of Gold Reserves Held at Fort Knox | LatestLY**
US President Donald Trump has announced plans to inspect Fort Knox, a vault in Kentucky that holds over half of the US's gold reserves, to ensure that the 400 tonnes of gold are present. Trump stated, 'I'm going to do something... All my life I've heard about Fort Knox. That's where the gold is kept, right? We're getting the yips on this stuff. I want to find out. So we're going to open up the doors. I'm going to see if we have gold there.' This comes after a letter from Senator Rand Paul requesting an audit of Fort Knox and testing of the gold held there. Paul stated, 'I request an audit of the Mint's holdings, including testing of the gold. I further ask for in-person inspection of the entire Depository and other holdings to be conducted by my staff and me.' The gold reserves at Fort Knox are valued at 147.3 million ounces, equivalent to nearly 370,000 standard-sized gold bars.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 22, 2025 06:48 AM
Source:[LatestLY](https://www.latestly.com/agency-news/world-news-trump-gives-call-for-inspecting-americas-400-tonnes-of-gold-reserves-held-at-fort-knox-6661479.html)

**Trump wants to make sure the gold's still there at Fort Knox**
President Donald Trump has announced plans to inspect the gold reserves at Fort Knox, the US Bullion Depository in Kentucky, to ensure that the gold is still present. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has stated that there is an annual audit and that 'all the gold is present and accounted for'. The depository has stored precious metal bullion reserves for the US since 1937 and has become synonymous with secure and well-protected storage. According to the US Mint, the current gold holdings at Fort Knox are 147.3 million ounces, worth an estimated $425 billion today. The facility is heavily guarded and has a strict policy of not allowing visitors, but has been opened three times in the past, including in 1974 and 2017. Current Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has offered to arrange an inspection for any senator who is interested in seeing the vaults. Trump said, 'We're going to open up the doors. We're going to inspect Fort Knox. I don't want to open it and the cupboards are bare,' he added.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:38 PM
Source:[Economic Times](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/global-trends/trump-wants-to-make-sure-the-golds-still-there-at-fort-knox/articleshow/118460461.cms)

**Elon Musk to be let inside Fort Knox depository to inspect gold reserves**
President Donald Trump has announced plans to allow Elon Musk to inspect the gold reserves at the United States Bullion Depository at Fort Knox, a move that has been met with reassurance from Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, who said 'all the gold is present and accounted for.' The depository, which has stored precious metal bullion reserves for the United States since 1937, is heavily guarded and has a reputation for being impenetrable. According to the U.S. Mint, the current gold holdings at Fort Knox are 147.3 million ounces, with about half of the Treasury's stored gold kept at the facility. The gold's book value is $42.22 per ounce, and only small quantities have been removed for testing during regular audits. 'We're going to open up the doors. We're going to inspect Fort Knox,' Trump said, adding 'I don't want to open it and the cupboards are bare.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 21, 2025 03:00 PM
Source:[CBS News](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/fort-knoxs-gold-trump-elon-musk/)

**What to know about Fort Knox's gold depository**
President Donald Trump has announced plans to inspect Fort Knox, the legendary depository in Kentucky that stores American gold reserves, to ensure the gold is still present. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has stated that there is an annual audit and 'all the gold is present and accounted for.' The United States Bullion Depository at Fort Knox has stored precious metal bullion reserves since 1937 and is known for its security. According to the U.S. Mint, the current gold holdings at Fort Knox are 147.3 million ounces, with about half of the Treasury's stored gold kept at the facility. Only small quantities of gold have been removed for testing during audits, and the gold's book value is $42.22 per ounce.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 21, 2025 09:27 AM
Source:[The New Indian Express](https://www.newindianexpress.com/world/2025/Feb/21/what-to-know-about-fort-knoxs-gold-depository-in-kentucky)

**Elon Musk targets Fort Knox where the US stores its gold reserves: What is it?**
Elon Musk has expressed skepticism about the US gold reserves stored at Fort Knox, questioning whether the gold is still intact. He called for a 'live video walkthrough' of the facility, which was supported by US Senator Rand Paul. The US Mint currently holds 147.3 million troy ounces of gold at Fort Knox, valued at $6 billion, but market prices exceed $435 billion. Despite concerns about security and transparency, the US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has reaffirmed that Fort Knox is regularly audited and all the gold is present and accounted for. He also expressed openness to allowing interested senators to inspect the vaults personally.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 20, 2025 11:54 AM
Source:[Firstpost](https://www.firstpost.com/explainers/what-is-fort-knox-history-purpose-elon-musk-donald-trump-us-gold-reserves-rand-paul-13865012.html)

**Rand Paul Suggests DOGE Help Audit Fort Knox Gold Reserves**
Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) is pushing for an audit of the gold reserves at Fort Knox, suggesting that the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) help in the endeavor. Paul proposed this after Elon Musk, who is overseeing the DOGE effort, questioned whether the gold reserves are regularly reviewed. According to the United States Mint website, Fort Knox has 147.3 million ounces of gold holdings, valued at $42.22 per ounce. Paul has been trying to gain access to the Fort Knox gold vaults for a decade, but was unable to do so in 2017 when the bullion depository opened for a second time. Paul believes that more sunlight and transparency are needed, and that the audit will bring attention to the fact that gold still has value and implicitly backs the dollar.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 08:18 PM
Source:[The Daily Wire](https://www.dailywire.com/news/rand-paul-suggests-doge-help-audit-fort-knox-gold-reserves)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, the US Mint updates their records of gold holdings very infrequently. The reported amount of gold at Fort Knox has remained constant at 147.3 million ounces for many decades. This institutional inertia suggests a high likelihood that there will be no change in the reported figure by the specified date. Historical consistency in reporting gold reserves by government entities is common worldwide, providing a strong base rate for predicting no change.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Government Reporting Consistency
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The US Mint and US government have a history of consistent reporting when it comes to gold holdings, with no significant changes reported in more than half a century. This consistency increases the likelihood that the current figure of 147.3 million ounces will remain unchanged on April 1, 2025.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Recent Economic and Political Stability
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The absence of any recent significant political or economic turmoil suggests continuity in financial reporting practices, reinforcing the probability that the gold holdings report remains unchanged in the short term.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Media and Public Discourse
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: While media speculation, for example, by figures like Elon Musk, might spur public curiosity and skepticism, they do not directly influence official reporting by the US Mint. Thus, this factor has no significant impact on the probability.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The US Mint consistently states that Fort Knox gold holdings are 147.3 million ounces. Treasury officials and various sources reaffirm this number, stressing regular audits and security. This institutional consistency and openness to audits reinforce the likelihood that the reported amount will not change.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Recent comments by Elon Musk and Donald Trump, as well as media attention, have incited public interest and speculation about the accuracy of Fort Knox's reported gold holdings. Discussions about potential audits could lead to new disclosures which might challenge existing official figures.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, the U.S. Mint has consistently stated the gold holdings at Fort Knox to be around 147.3 million ounces. Over the past several decades, there has been little to no official change in the reported gold holdings, suggesting a relatively stable baseline. This continuity indicates that, barring any major policy changes or significant discoveries, the reported figure will likely remain the same.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Public Trust and Audit Frequency
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The U.S. Mint and related agencies have not conducted a full audit of Fort Knox in many years, and there is public pressure and conspiracy theories surrounding its actual holdings. However, without an audit, there is little incentive to change the reported figures. This lack of auditing slightly increases the likelihood they stick with the known figure to maintain status quo.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Media Influence and Public Statements
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: High-profile media coverage or public statements by influential figures like Musk can draw attention to these matters, potentially influencing whether officials feel pressured to verify or update records. However, given the traditional policy of the U.S. Mint, this influence is minor, providing only a marginal increase in probability.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technological Developments
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Advancements in reporting and administrative procedures could encourage updating data on official resources. However, given the traditional and infrequent nature of changes to Fort Knox's reported holdings, this factor is believed to have negligible impact.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Numerous sources, including the U.S. Mint and the Treasury Secretary, reaffirm the current gold holdings at Fort Knox as 147.3 million ounces. Statements from officials maintain that regular audits have confirmed the presence and accounting of all gold reserves.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Elon Musk and Donald Trump's planned visit to Fort Knox, accompanied by high visibility and public interest, may lead to increased scrutiny of the reported gold holdings. Their involvement, along with recent discussions and conspiracy theories, introduce uncertainty regarding the official reports.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, the US Mint has not frequently adjusted the reported gold holdings of Fort Knox. The last reported figure for gold holdings by the US Mint has commonly been 147.3 million ounces. Given this historical consistency, the base rate for the number of holdings reported as 147.3 million ounces not changing is high. Over the past decades, there have been few changes to the reported amount held at Fort Knox, and previous public speculation or rumors have not typically led to official adjustments. Therefore, I am starting with a high initial probability for the reported amount remaining the same.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Public Records Consistency
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: In government public records management, especially concerning significant assets like gold reserves, there is a high emphasis on consistency and transparency unless there is a compelling reason to alter public disclosures. The US Mint has historically maintained consistent reporting metrics, particularly for notable symbolic assets like the gold holdings in Fort Knox.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Historical Resistance to Speculation
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The US government, especially entities like the US Mint, is historically resistant to making changes or updates to official statements or records in response to public speculation or pressure. The mention of Elon Musk concerning Fort Knox gold is unlikely to sway reported figures unless there is solid evidence behind it.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Internal Verification Practices
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The verification processes and audits of such declarations are rigorous in the US treasury system. Any significant changes to public statements about reserves like Fort Knox's gold holdings would require internal audits and substantiation, which are infrequent and based on need rather than public discourse.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The news articles indicate that despite public speculation driven by Elon Musk and Donald Trump, the US Mint consistently reports the gold holdings at Fort Knox as 147.3 million ounces. Numerous articles cite confirmations from the US Mint and the Treasury Secretary that the gold reserves are present, accounted for, and audited regularly. These points reinforce the notion that the official listing on April 1 will reflect the same figure.

summary: The consensus among the experts is that the US Mint will report the gold holdings at Fort Knox as 147.3 million ounces on April 1, 2025. The experts' initial probability estimates ranged from 85% to 95%, based on the historical consistency of the US Mint's reporting and the lack of significant incentives or events that would lead to a change. After considering recent news and public speculation, such as comments from Elon Musk and Donald Trump, most experts maintained or slightly adjusted their probabilities, with revised probabilities ranging from 85% to 100%. The experts generally concluded that despite public interest and scrutiny, there is no substantial evidence or policy change suggesting a deviation from the reported figure.
